title: How to Make Pastel De Papa

steps.headline: Make mashed potatoes.
steps.description: Chop the potatoes into chunks, boil until mashable, and then mash away. Add a quarter or a half a stick of butter, as well as some salt and pepper to taste.

steps.headline: Chop and sauté a large onion with cumin until soft and sweet.
Hard boil the eggs.
steps.description: Peel and chop into small pieces.

steps.headline: Pan fry two or two and a half pounds of ground beef.
steps.description: Drain when almost cooked. Add onion, paprika, salt and pepper to taste.

steps.headline: Grease a nine-by-nine-inch (23cm x 23cm) oven dish.
steps.description: Good trick: If you have the paper from a stick of butter, don't throw it out. Rub the buttery side along the dish to grease it. Waste not, want not!

steps.headline: Spread a layer of mashed potatoes along the bottom and sides of the dish.
steps.description: Use a little more than half of the mashed potatoes. Make the layer about a half an inch (1.3cm) thick (but less so on the sides). Sprinkle with half the shredded cheese.

steps.headline: Spread a layer of ground beef.
steps.description: Gently press it down with a spatula to compact it. Add a layer of hard boiled egg.

steps.headline: Apply another layer of mashed potatoes.
Top with the remaining cheese and some paprika.
Bake in a preheated oven at 350ºF/180ºC until the top is just starting to turn golden brown (approximately 15-30 minutes).
Remove from the oven and let the dish stand for 10 minutes at room temperature.
steps.description: Use a spatula to divide and serve.
